newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS - Corporate Earnings.
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS - Corporate Earnings.

text.p: The maker of electronic parts and aircraft instruments posted second quarter earnings of $0.34 a share compared with $0.27 last year and said it expects stronger results during the second half of its fiscal year.
Analysts' consensus estimates were for second quarter earnings of $0.31 a share, according to First Call.

Stock was one of the top losers on the NYSE on Tuesday after it posted first quarter earnings after the market close on Monday. The computer internetworking company posted earnings per share of $0.25 a share before a charge compared with $0.32 a share in the year-ago period. 1996 earnings were $0.03 a share for the quarter after the charge.

Wall Street had expected the company to earn $0.29 a share, according to First Call. The company's chief executive Andrew Ludwick resigned and three brokerage firms cut their stock ratings of Bay Networks.
O'Sullivan Industries Holdings Inc up 3/4 to 10-3/8
Shares hit a new high of 10-7/8 during intraday trading after the Lamar, Mo., company posted first quarter profits of $0.21 a share compared to $0.08 in the year-ago period.
Analysts estimated the maker of ready-to-assemble furniture would earn about $0.15 a share.

Shares hit a new 52-week high of 83 in heavy intraday trading. Bank posted third quarter earnings of $1.80 a share compared to $1.58 on a primary basis and $1.78 a share compared to $1.55 on a fully diluted basis. First Call mean consensus estimates by analysts were $1.82 a share.

Company posted third quarter earnings of $0.63 a share compared to $0.33 in the year-ago. Sales rose only $3 million, to $336.7 million compared to $333.8 million from last year. The company cited lower shipments of "Jerzees" product to domestic retail accounts and a tough competitive environment in Europe in a statement.
